00007 // Allocate a tag of the specified size for these_entities (could
00008 // just be a single entity too);
00009 // Input:
00010 // Mesh *mesh: the interface instance you're working with
00011 // Entity_Handle *these_entities: entities to which this tag will be
00012 //     associated
00013 // const Int num_entities: number of these_entities
00014 // const char *tag_name: the application-assigned name for this tag
00015 // const Int tag_size: the size of data to be allocated for this tag
00016 // const void *default_value: the default value used to initialize
00017 //     this tag
00018 //
00019 // Output:
00020 // TSTT_Tag_Handle *tag_handle: handle by which tag can be referred to;
00021 //   if void, tag_handle is not returned
00022 // MeshError *errorReturn: the return value for the function
00023 //
00024 virtual void Mesh_AddTag_Entities(Mesh *mesh,
00025                                   Entity_Handle *these_entities, 
00026                                   const Int num_entities,
00027                                   const char* tag_name, const Int tag_size,
00028                                   const void *default_value,
00029                                   Tag_Handle *tag_handle,
00030                                   MeshError *errorReturn)=0;
00031 
00032 // Allocate a tag of the specified size to all entities of the
00033 // specified type.  
00034 // Input:
00035 // (most args similar to Mesh_AddTag_Entities, only new ones listed here)
00036 // const Int individual_values: if = 1, each entity of the specified type
00037 //   is allowed to have a unique value of this tag; if = 0, one value of
00038 //   this tag is allowed for the specified type
00039 // const Int future_too: if = 1 and individual_values = 1, all entities 
00040 //   of the specified type created subsequently are given this tag, 
00041 //   otherwise only extant entities of the specified type are given this tag.
00042 //   This argument is ignored if individual_values = 0
00043 virtual void Mesh_AddTag_EntityType(Mesh *mesh,
00044                                     const EntityType entity_type, 
00045                                     const char* name, const Int tag_size,
00046                                     const void *default_value,
00047                                     const Int individual_values,
00048                                     const Int future_too,
00049                                     Tag_Handle *tag_handle,
00050                                     MeshError *errorReturn)=0;
00051     
00052 // Allocate a tag of the specified size to all entities of the
00053 // specified topology (a single tag value per entity topology is allowed)
00054 // (args similar to Mesh_AddTag_EntityType)
00055 virtual void Mesh_AddTag_EntityTopology(Mesh *mesh,
00056                                         const Int entity_topology, 
00057                                         const char* name, const Int tag_size,
00058                                         const void *default_value,
00059                                         const Int individual_values,
00060                                         const Int future_too,
00061                                         Tag_Handle *tag_handle,
00062                                         MeshError *errorReturn)=0;

00084 // De-allocate the tag named tag_name from these_entities
00085 //
00086 // Input:
00087 // Mesh *mesh: the interface instance you're working with
00088 // Entity_Handle *these_entities: the entities from which this tag
00089 //   will be de-allocated 
00090 // const Int num_entities: number of entities in that list
00091 // const char *tag_name: the tag name which will be de-allocated
00092 //
00093 // Output:
00094 // MeshError *errorReturn: the return flag for this function
00095 virtual void Mesh_DeleteTag_Entities(Mesh *mesh,
00096                                      Entity_Handle *these_entities, 
00097                                      const Int num_entities,
00098                                      cTag_Handle tag_handle, 
00099                                      MeshError *errorReturn)=0;

00101 // De-allocate the tag named tag_name from entities of the specified
00102 // type 
00103 // Input:
00104 // (most arguments similar to Mesh_DeleteTag_Entities, those aren't repeated
00105 //  here)
00106 // const Int just_future: if = 1, the tag is not de-allocated from 
00107 //   current entities, it just won't be allocated for future entities
00108 //   (i.e. this reverses the effect of the "future_too" argument in
00109 //   Mesh_AddTag_EntityType)
00110 virtual void Mesh_DeleteTag_EntityType(Mesh *mesh,
00111                                        const EntityType entity_type,
00112                                        cTag_Handle tag_handle, 
00113                                        const Int just_future,
00114                                        MeshError *errorReturn)=0;

00121                                            const Int just_future,
00122                                            MeshError *errorReturn)=0;

00271 // Get the type of a tag of the specified name (mesh, meshset,
00272 // etc.)
00273 //
00274 // Input:
00275 // const Mesh *mesh: the interface you're asking about
00276 // cTag_Handle: the tag to get info about
00277 //
00278 // Output:
00279 // char **tag_name: the name of the tag
00280 // Int *tag_type: the type of the tag (0=Entity, 1=EntityType,
00281 //    2=EntityTopology, 3=MeshSet)
00282 // Int *individual: whether this tag varies by individual entity (=1) or not (=0)
00283 // Int *future: whether future entities created will get this tag (=1) or not (=0)
00284 // MeshError *errorReturn: the return value for the function
00285 //
00286 virtual void Mesh_Tag_GetInfo(const Mesh *mesh,
00287                               cTag_Handle tag_handle,
00288                               char **tag_name, 
00289                               Int *tag_type,
00290                               Int *individual,
00291                               Int *future,
00292                               MeshError *errorReturn) const =0;

00294 // Get the tag with the specified name
00295 //
00296 // Input:
00297 // const Mesh *mesh: the interface you're asking about
00298 // const char *tag_name: the name of the tag for which you want the handle
00299 //
00300 // Output:
00301 // Tag_Handle *tag_handle: handle for the specified tag
00302 // MeshError *errorReturn: the return value for the function
00303 //
00304 virtual void Mesh_Tag_GetHandle(const Mesh *mesh,
00305                                 const char *tag_name,
00306                                 Tag_Handle *tag_handle,
00307                                 MeshError *errorReturn) const =0;

00309 // Get the tags which exist in the mesh instance for the specified type
00310 //
00311 // Input:
00312 // const Mesh *mesh: the interface you're asking about
00313 // const Int tag_type: the tag type (0=Entity, etc.)
00314 //
00315 // Output:
00316 // Tag_Handle **tag_handles: vector of handles of existing tags
00317 // Int *num_tags: the number of tags in tag_handles
00318 // MeshError *errorReturn: the return value for the function
00319 //
00320 virtual void Mesh_Tag_GetTags(const Mesh *mesh,
00321                               const Int tag_type,
00322                               Tag_Handle **tag_handles,
00323                               Int *num_tags,
00324                               MeshError *errorReturn) const =0;
